observation: Charlotte REIA – Charlotte Real Estate Investors Association  Skip to content (704) 891-9619 | info@charlottereia.com Facebook-f Twitter Youtube Meetup CHARLOTTE AREA MONTHLY MEETINGS Home About Us About CharlotteREIA Subscribe to Email & Text Lists Code Of Ethics Membership Join Us Membership Forms Vendor Terms & Disclaimer Calendar Meetings News Resources Contact Us Menu JOIN US Charlotte REIA “Building Wealth One House At A Time” Become a Member About When we meet Events | Webinars Latest news Charlotte REIA Vendors Charlotte REIA Vendor Memberships get your business noticed! Commercial Sub Group Back On! REIA Members come out and join us the 2nd Monday of the month to The Multi-Family / Commercial Subgroup. Led by Adam Balsinger, a full time real estate investor since 2014. He’s Read More » Weekly Breakfast New Location If you just can’t wait until our next Charlotte REIA Main Monthly Meeting, join us every Wednesday morning (except major holidays) Early Risers: at 8:00AM Consistently Get Leads Online & Offline Monthly! MARCH MEMBER MARKETING MADNESS For Real Estate Entrepreneurs Thurs, March 5th 6:30 PM at RainTree Country Club How To Consistently Get Leads Online & Offline Testimonials The challenge is that most people need ongoing education and support to be successful. Unfortunately, they haven’t had a lot of choices in the past as to where to get it here locally. That’s why we formed Charlotte REIA. Linda Dana WANT TO JOIN US?

thought: The content extracted mentions Charlotte Real Estate Investors Association and seems to be focused on providing resources, meetings, and events for real estate investors. There are no obvious signs of unusually low prices, claims of large sums of money, or targeting of psychological weaknesses. The contact information provided includes a phone number and an email address which seems appropriate for a business.

thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain has been registered since 2003 and does not expire until 2028, which suggests a legitimate, long-standing presence. The registrant information is private, which is common for businesses to protect their privacy. The domain status also does not indicate any red flags such as being recently created or having a short registration period, which are common with scam websites. The website and WHOIS information do not show immediate signs of a scam. It's a real estate investors association which is a legitimate type of organization, and the domain has a long history. However, to be thorough, I should check for additional information such as customer reviews or external opinions on the site.
